title: BugEffect
subtitle: Scenario writing for short film

overview.value: “Bug Effect” is a short film scenario set in a **near-future dystopia**. The story explores the impact of **“Remember 3,”** a service offered by the company **“Inertial,”** which provides an **AI humanoid robot** designed to replace a deceased loved one and erase painful memories of their loss. This service, using the deceased's DNA, creates a robot with an identical appearance and memory. In a society that values emotional control and convenience, people willingly accept this as **a new form of a funeral** or mourning process.

The story follows Ji-gu, whose husband, Yuseong, has passed away. Initially, Ji-gu embraces “Remember 3,” believing it protects her from grief. However, a series of unsettling discoveries forces her to confront a painful truth: her beloved husband is dead. The story culminates in her conscious choice to reject the service's ‘maintenance’ procedures and fully embrace the grief she was meant to forget. In doing so, she **rejects societal norms** and reclaims her authentic self, finding happiness by accepting that life includes both sorrow and joy.

The narrative uses the **science-fiction genre** to explore deeper themes of **memory, grief, and what it means to be human**. The core conflict is not just between a person and a technology, but between the comfort of a fabricated reality and the difficult truth of authentic emotion. The title, “Bug Effect,” refers not only to the technical glitches in AI but also to the emotional ‘bugs’ that disrupt artificial peace and ultimately lead to **growth and self-acceptance**.

outcomes: **Earned full marks** across all evaluated stages (scenario, structure board, storyboard, and virtual trailer), and was selected as a Best Work by the professor.
Demonstrated proficiency in all stages of short film pre-production, including conceptualization, narrative structure, visual storytelling, and trailer creation.
Crafted a cohesive SF-romance mystery that explores deep ethical and philosophical themes through an emotionally compelling narrative.

subtitle: Original Song Composition and M/V Production

overview.value: “0505” is a song born from the desire to capture the fleeting flutter of youth. It is **our lifelong contract** left not on paper, but **in music** — a promise to stay together until spring flowers bloom in winter.

As the **Creative Director and Composer** for RGBN, I led the entire production lifecycle, from composing the full band score to directing the music video. My goal was to systematically engineer an emotional nostalgia through sound and visuals.

**· Musical Composition**: I wrote the lyrics and arranged the full score for all instruments (drums, bass, two guitars, keys, vocals). To evoke the “fleeting wonder of youth,” I deliberately designed the soundscape with retro synth textures, distortions, and rhythmic variations.

**· Visual Narrative**: I directed, filmed, and edited the music video to extend the song’s story. Using two different aspect ratios and color grading, I visualized the protagonist’s perspective of finding a camera on the street and reliving cherished memories through its viewfinder. This created a seamless synchronization between the auditory build-up and the visual storytelling.

outcomes: Composed and released RGBN’s first original single on SoundCloud, managing the entire recording and production process.
Directed and produced a narrative music video for YouTube, successfully translating the song’s auditory themes into a visual narrative.

Received high praise from renowned poet **Prof. Jeong Kkeut-byeol** for the lyrical depth and narrative structure, recognizing the work as a successful fusion of literary sensibility and multimedia production.

overview.value: Someday, we’ll look back on this moment — our blue spring. “Dear” is a love letter we dedicate to us, who have become each other’s entire blue spring without noticing it.
This is an ongoing project for its recording and music video.
